html: I've been #T1diabetic 46 years. On a trip to France 2 years ago, I bought insulin at a pharmacy. The cost for a box of 5 insulin pens - the same pen as I get here in the U.S. - was +/- $65 USD. In the States, 1 pen costs me $90, and that's my out-of-pocket WITH insurance.

html: The DOJ briefed the WH on the #MuellerReport before the American public has seen it. AG Barr now refuses to release the report until after his press conference. Enough is enough. This is not a PR campaign. Americans deserve the chance to make a judgment call for themselves.
text:
The DOJ briefed the WH on the #MuellerReport before the American public has seen it. AG Barr now refuses to release the report until after his press conference. 

Enough is enough. This is not a PR campaign. Americans deserve the chance to make a judgment call for themselves.

html: A Houston immigration court that ordered an 11-year-old girl deported alone has reopened the case and set a new hearing for the girl, Laura Maradiaga-Alvarado, for May 20 at 8:30 am. She was ordered deported after the court erroneously said she did not show up for a hearing.
text: A Houston immigration court that ordered an 11-year-old girl deported alone has reopened the case and set a new hearing for the girl, Laura Maradiaga-Alvarado, for May 20 at 8:30 am. She was ordered deported after the court erroneously said she did not show up for a hearing.

html: Something you may not have thought of: When the feds build the wall in a border town -- let's say Roma, Texas -- they reduce the value of private property that the wall bisects. Appraisals fall, which reduces the property taxes feeding some of the nation's poorest places.
text:
Something you may not have thought of: When the feds build the wall in a border town -- let's say Roma, Texas -- they reduce the value of private property that the wall bisects. 

Appraisals fall, which reduces the property taxes feeding some of the nation's poorest places.

html: Saddened by news of former #TX U.S. Congressman Ralph Hall’s passing today. He was the oldest member to serve in Congress, and one of the last two WWII vets that served. Thoughts are with his family during their time of mourning.

html: I’m a non-Spanish speaking Hispanic. I grew up with 4 grandparents who spoke Spanish around us. Later on I was sad to learn they thought they were “protecting” or “helping” us by not teaching us Spanish. Yet growing in up in So. CA, I was called “beaner” & “wetback”. Go figure.
text:
I’m a non-Spanish speaking Hispanic. I grew up with 4 grandparents who spoke Spanish around us. Later on I was sad to learn they thought they were “protecting” or “helping” us by not teaching us Spanish. 

Yet growing in up in So. CA, I was called “beaner” & “wetback”. Go figure.

html: My mother’s family were Italian immigrants. The only one in the house allowed to speak Italian was her Granny. Grandpa even changed the spelling of their last name to make it look more American. So the ‘they need to assimilate’ argument is weak - then and now.

html: I totally relate to everything you have said on this subject. My favorite kind of racism was my white friends saying that I wasn't really Mexican because I spoke English so well and didn't fit stereotypes. Sometimes I pushed back but mostly just ignored it.
text: I totally relate to everything you have said on this subject. My favorite kind of racism was my white friends saying that I wasn't really Mexican because I spoke English so well and didn't fit stereotypes. Sometimes I pushed back but mostly just ignored it.

html: Yup. I remember how we looked down at the kids who only spoke Spanish when I was in elementary school. No reason to dislike them other than our parents taught us they were lesser.
text: Yup. I remember how we looked down at the kids who only spoke Spanish when I was in elementary school. No reason to dislike them other than our parents taught us they were lesser.

html: Final: All of this (and more) leads to a kind of self-hatred. In the neighborhoods where I grew up kids used to deride each other as “wetbacks” or “mojados,” an ethnic slurs against Mexicans.

html: How would the 3-year DACA protection work legislatively? There’s no existing program in law to “extend.” Would it be lawfully-enforceable “legal status”? Or executive grace? If it’s the latter, what’s to stop the administration from rescinding the work permits if it wants to?
text:
How would the 3-year DACA protection work legislatively?

There’s no existing program in law to “extend.”

Would it be lawfully-enforceable “legal status”? Or executive grace?

If it’s the latter, what’s to stop the administration from rescinding the work permits if it wants to?

html: It's infuriating, but here's where we are: McConnell won't call a vote on the House-passed bills to reopen the government because he knows they will pass the Senate too. And Republicans' #1 priority isn't ending the shutdown, it's staying on Trump's good side.
text:
It's infuriating, but here's where we are:

McConnell won't call a vote on the House-passed bills to reopen the government because he knows they will pass the Senate too.  And Republicans' #1 priority isn't ending the shutdown, it's staying on Trump's good side.
